Key:
Huh? Where'd they go? I can't find my chopsticks.
I thought I put them together after I ate with
them.

Oh, don't worry. Friends always help each other.
Like when you helped me study.

I see. Thanks, but man, these look practically
brand new. You didn't have to do that.
I don't mind. For me, this is a treat.

O-Origami, are you reading a thick reference
book on your lunch break?
I just want to use my time wisely.

Do you ever read, uh, interesting books or
manga on your days off?

My days off are often spent observing Shido's
modus operandi, or training.

I see...Wait, what?! Did you just say
you observe me?!

I contacted them various times without reply,
so I decided to go there myself.

I thought you weren't allowed to go in and
out freely.

As I thought, there were no traces of Spirit
waves on the AST.

You thought so? The observation tool at the
Tengu Garrison is the best in the world. Why
would you think so, Shido?

I don't know much either, but it feels like the
barrier itself is well-hidden.

Because of the barrier, we're completely cut
off from everything outside Tengu City. I heard
it affects the observation tool as well.

Then, how were you able to find out about the
barrier?

(I can't tell her that I know someone who's
running the observation tool.)

A-Anyways, what's really scary is that no one
even realizes they're trapped.

Don't you think? We're the only ones who are
even aware of what's going on, right?
To top it off, no one can break the barrier.
If only we could figure out what they want.

At the very least, we know they're not our
allies. Especially if they're trapping us
because they're after the Spirits.

Besides, because of this barrier, Tohka and
the girls could more easily go on a rampage.

I mean, Origami, you don't want anyone to
suffer like you have, right?

If the enemy's goal is to destabilize the
Spirits within the barrier, then I will do all
in my power to prevent that. I will destroy it.

(Whoa. Origami doesn't change her expression
much, but when it comes to the Spirits, the
anger really comes through.)

(Yet another reason I want to make Origami
smile. I hope to make a real, genuine smile
come out of her.)
